tourName: Southern Australia & Tasmania tailor made holiday
placesVisited: Maria Island, Tasmania, Darlington, Hobart, Melbourne, Otway National Park, Great Ocean Road, Grampians National Park, Adelaide, Flinders Ranges, scenic flight over Wilpena Pound
generalInfo:
This two week tour of southern Australia can be tailor made to take travellers to some of the most fascinating locations in Victoria, South Australia and Tasmania as part of a varied itinerary designed to appeal to walkers, wildlife watchers and aboriginal heritage lovers alike.

Southern Australia is made for outdoor enthusiasts, which is why this holiday incorporates many of the region’s most important natural highlights via a variety of suggested activities and adventures.

From a four day guided hike on Tasmania’s Maria Island to a self-drive road trip from Victoria to South Australia and a couple of nights in the breathtaking Flinders Ranges National Park, the highlights on this holiday come thick and fast as well as including plenty of free time to sit back and take it all in.

Aside from the historic settings and natural attractions, travellers can also look forward to a good choice of overnight accommodation with sustainable campsites and locally-owned guesthouses offering experiences that are often just as highly anticipated as what you can expect during the day.

dayInfo.description: Start your itinerary with a full day of leisure in Hobart and perhaps time your visit so that you can take advantage of the Salamanca Market, which runs on a Saturday.

You will be collected from your hotel this morning for the start of your 4-day walking adventure of Maria Island, travelling east out of Hobart and across to the peaceful shores of the island, arriving in time for the first of your delicious meals on tour complete with Tasmanian local produce. In the afternoon you will have the opportunity to properly stretch your legs, with the choice of a walk to a dramatic cliff lookout, or simply relaxing and starting your unwinding process on the pristine local beaches.

Wake up to the sounds of the forest around you and to the smell of a freshly cooked breakfast. The second day of your trip takes you to five beaches, all of them different and aside from the beautiful walking that they present, you will also get an insight into the local convict history with a visit to the ruins of a convict settlement and plenty of opportunities for a refreshing swim. Arriving at your second camp, you will have time to relax before a three course meal of local fare will end your day.

Walking through the forests of Tasmanian Blue Gums at the start of day three keep an eye out for the endangered forty-spotted pardalote as this is prime habitat for these rare birds. This afternoon you have a choice of mountains to take on, Mount Maria or Bishop and Clerk. Both offer excellent 360 degree views of the island and its coastline. Enjoy Tasmanian wine and cheese on the veranda of your accommodation, the historical colonial home once occupied by Italian entrepreneur, Diego Bernacchi, while once again a sumptuous dinner will end your day.

This morning you have some free time to explore the deserted town of Darlington and the history of Bernacchi's empire. The Coffee Palace has been turned into a simple museum to illustrate the different eras of the town's settlement. You may also choose to take the circuit walk to the fascinating Fossil Cliffs or Painted Cliffs which have been beautifully carved by the sea. After a delicious lunch the tour departs from Darlington on the ferry to Triabunna and then returns to Hobart via the historical village of Richmond. You will spend one final night in Hobart at your bed and breakfast.

This morning you will depart Tasmania and fly across to the mainland and the city of Melbourne (flight included). Pick up your hire car at the Melbourne airport and start your journey along the Great Ocean Road, tonight spending the night on the edge of the Otway National Park.

Spend today at leisure in the Otway National Park, spending the day spotting koalas in the wild and with your hosts at the Great Ocean Ecolodge Conservation Centre, perhaps helping to look after some of their injured wildlife which they take care of.

Today's driving takes you past some of this itineraries most iconic destinations, such as the 'Twelve Apostles' and the 'London Bridge', and the Great Ocean Road's most stunning stretch of coastline. Your day finishes in the beautiful fishing village of Port Fairy.

Your drive ventures inland today as you drive north from Port Fairy and into the lesser explored Grampians National Park. This drive is only a couple of hours, so spend the afternoon exploring your surroundings.

A full day at leisure today to enjoy your surrounds and be active with a day of hiking in the magnificent national park, or less so, and sit back in your accommodation and watch mobs of kangaroos hop past as the day unfolds.
Your journey sees you travel west today and across the state boundary into South Australia and onwards to the state capital of Adelaide where you will spend the next couple of nights.

Today you will drive north out of Adelaide and into the stunning Flinders Ranges to take in this dramatic mountain range and gain a true feeling of the Australian outback. On arrival at Rawnsley Park Station, you will check into your Eco Villa and meet your hosts who will advise you of the array of activities on offer to enjoy your day at leisure. You may like to embark on the network of excellent bushwalking trails using the tour maps provided, take a horseriding trek or take advantage of relaxing in the swimming pool followed by a leisurely meal at the Woolshed Restaurant.

You will be collected from your Eco Villa this morning to embark on your full day 4WD tour. Here you will take in the most spectacular scenery of the Flinders Ranges which showcases the wildlife, geology, Aboriginal and European history of the region. All tours are conducted by experienced local guides in modern 4WD vehicles. You will be returned to your Eco Villa this afternoon after an interactive and informative day.

There's no better way to see Wilpena Pound than from the air and a thirty minute scenic flight is included for you direct from Rawnsley Park Station. You will depart early this morning and enjoy the spectacular scenery from a small Cessna 206 aircraft. Later, return to Adelaide where your itinerary concludes.
